text: Ah but my client don't accept this solution he just want signature option form.can you please help me to find a solution for this

Can you explain to me how the client imagines it? 

DocuSign just has a button and the signature pops out there or it can also be written. It comes with a digital timestamp and accepted almost everywhere. *What’s* the issue you’re trying to solve here?
client want to this type signture field
I would say better just use the integration in this case unless you want to add an HTML block to your form (available in CMS Hub and Marketing Hub Professional and Enterprise).

Hey everyone!

Does someone have a clever workaround/idea on how to manage Deals which have different sub items and where these subitems can have different close dates? :slightly_smiling_face:

Like a deal has 4 different items and these 4 items can have different close dates in different months etc. etc.

Looking for a nice and clean solution :slightly_smiling_face: So any ideas are welcome! :slightly_smiling_face:
Hello all, is possible to create like this cookie banner in HubSpot
This banner having two buttons for, cookies 1st accept all, and another is personalise like user can choose.
I have only seen this functionality in CookieBot. We’ve not been too successful modifying HubSpot’s functionality.
But cookieBot having their own pricing and I already take content hub enterprise, so I think this should be in HubSpot

I don’t disagree. Maybe others have ideas? We just haven’t pushed it further because the out of the box functionality with HubSpot keeps the client in compliance with cookie acceptance. We don’t want the liability of a potential issue.
:wave: Hi everyone! New here, redirected from HubSpot support with a question about setting up a webhook via Data Ops

Trying to send a webhook request to Neverbounce upon contact creation; the webhook URL ends with ‘&email={email}‘. I need to replace {email] with the email value from the contact record; anyone know what the syntax should be? Have tried ‘&email=Contact.email’ and similar with no luck. Basically, just need to push a variable from the contact data into the URL I’m passing via the webhook to Neverbounce

<@U061UQWC9KR> appreciate you being available to support further with this. I'm having issues when adding the CSS noted above by Ahmed. I've tried adding it in various places and it keeps showing directly on the page.

I've tried adding it to the blog template, the html of an individual blog and the header for the blogs and all have the same result, showing the code directly on the page as per the attached image. I'ce also attached an image to show how I'm adding it to the blog template header.

Can you please let me know if I'm missing some part of code to get this to apply rather than show?

Thansk!

Yes - HubSpot cookie banners give you the ability to  select/deselect types of preferences.
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/privacy-and-consent/customize-your-cookie-tracking-settings-and-consent-banner>
If you need or want finer control (for instance if you did want to use a 3rd party banner) there are many JS functions to help - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/analytics-and-events/cookie-banner/cookie-banner-api>
Thank you so much <@UJJ239SC9>  for sharing, I'll start working on it.

Hey <@U07TYC7NSTG> - you should be able to just select the property from the list of properties from the enrolled contact and it will insert the dynamic data token into the webhook URL or body. Here are screenshots of both a Post request and a Get request

You can test the outgoing webhook using a service like a RequestBin from Pipedream

A general note if you're working with dynamic data tokens in HubSpot - most of the time the token will be abstracted into a pick list menu like this, so you don't need to worry about the exact syntax, but pretty much every token in the background uses a double curly brace syntax - i.e. `{{contact.email}}`

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!
For future reference, we now have a <#C07NCTHHQJK|HubSpot-cookie-banner> channel

Hi there folks! This is my first post here in the community. Not sure which channel is the most appropriate one to post this: We want to create an integration between our platform and the HS instances of clients that authorize our HS app. We created an app with multiple permissions (like editing deals, organizations, read access, etc), several ones. This generates a link that can be used to "install" the app as I understand. When I load that link (that looks like this):

```<https://app.HubSpot.com/oauth/authorize?client_id=[the_client_id]&redirect_uri=https://url.com/HubSpot/callback&scope=crm.schemas.companies.write%20crm.schemas.contacts.write%20crm.objects.line_items.read%20crm.schemas.deals.read%20crm.objects.line_items.write%20crm.schemas.deals.write%20crm.schemas.orders.write%20crm.import%20collector.graphql_schema.read%20crm.schemas.orders.read%20collector.graphql_query.execute%20crm.objects.orders.write%20oauth%20crm.objects.orders.read%20conversations.read%20crm.objects.listings.read%20crm.objects.leads.read%20crm.objects.listings.write%20crm.objects.leads.write>...```
and I try to authorize the app, I get this message:

```Authorization failed because this account doesn't have access to the scopes required by the app. Please contact HubSpot support.```
I understand there's some mismatch between the permissions in the link and the actual permissions of the app, but as I understand that link gets updated depending of which permissions I add (I am copying the link from the section in the attached image), so what I could be doing wrong? Is there a way to get more details about this error to be able to solve it?
Great, thank you! Will give this a shot

If you're trying to install this in a test portal or your own HubSpot account it's probably the GraphQL scope requests. Your account would need Content Hub or Sales/Service Enterprise for that.

You could try making those conditional too

The issue isn't likely a disconnect between the scopes of the link and the scopes of the app, it's that the HubSpot account where you're trying to install the app doesn't have subscriptions to all of the features that you're requesting integration permissions for
...probably
You can select which properties you want to get from HS in the CRM card settings, HS sends the object id and portal Id by default
